title: Famous Duos & Partners
description: How well do you know history's most famous pairs and partnerships?

questions.question: Who was the comedy partner of Dean Martin in their famous duo?
questions.explanation: Dean Martin and Jerry Lewis were one of the most popular comedy teams in the 1940s and 1950s, starring in 16 films together.

questions.question: Lewis and Clark were famous for exploring what part of the United States?
questions.explanation: Meriwether Lewis and William Clark led the famous expedition (1804-1806) to explore the western territories after the Louisiana Purchase.

questions.question: In the famous ice skating duo, who was Torvill's partner?
questions.explanation: Jayne Torvill and Christopher Dean won the Olympic gold medal in 1984 for their legendary 'Bolero' ice dance routine.

questions.question: Which duo created the first successful airplane flight in 1903?
questions.explanation: Orville and Wilbur Wright achieved the first powered flight on December 17, 1903, at Kitty Hawk, North Carolina.

questions.question: Simon & Garfunkel are best known for which hit song?
questions.explanation: Paul Simon and Art Garfunkel's 'Bridge Over Troubled Water' (1970) became one of the best-selling singles of all time.

questions.question: Who was Bonnie Parker's partner in crime?
questions.explanation: Bonnie Parker and Clyde Barrow were infamous outlaws who robbed banks and stores across the central United States during the Great Depression.

questions.question: Which famous duo discovered radium together?
questions.explanation: Marie and Pierre Curie discovered radium and polonium together, sharing the 1903 Nobel Prize in Physics.

questions.question: In the classic comedy duo Laurel and Hardy, who was the thin one?
options: Neither â€” they were both large
questions.explanation: Stan Laurel was the thin, bumbling half of the duo, while Oliver Hardy was the larger, more pompous partner.

questions.question: Which duo wrote many of The Beatles' most famous songs?
questions.explanation: John Lennon and Paul McCartney formed one of the most successful songwriting partnerships in music history.

questions.question: Batman's famous partner Robin is also known as what?
questions.explanation: Robin, Batman's sidekick, has been known as 'The Boy Wonder' since his first appearance in 1940.

questions.question: Which famous duo hosted a morning TV show together for decades, known as 'Live'?
questions.explanation: Regis Philbin and Kathie Lee Gifford co-hosted 'Live with Regis and Kathie Lee' from 1988 to 2000.

questions.question: Watson and Crick are famous for discovering the structure of what?
questions.explanation: James Watson and Francis Crick discovered the double helix structure of DNA in 1953, revolutionizing biology.

questions.question: Which singing duo had the hit 'I Got You Babe' in 1965?
questions.explanation: Sonny Bono and Cher's 'I Got You Babe' reached number one in 1965 and launched their career as a duo.

questions.question: Which famous Western duo was played by Paul Newman and Robert Redford?
options: Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid
questions.explanation: The 1969 film 'Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid' starred Newman and Redford as the legendary outlaw pair.

questions.question: Fred Astaire's most famous dance partner in films was whom?
questions.explanation: Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers starred together in 10 musical films and became the most iconic dance partnership in cinema history.

questions.question: Which duo are the title characters in Shakespeare's most famous love story?
questions.explanation: Romeo and Juliet, written around 1597, is perhaps the most famous love story ever written.

questions.question: Ben & Jerry's ice cream company was founded in what state?
questions.explanation: Ben Cohen and Jerry Greenfield opened their first ice cream shop in a renovated gas station in Burlington, Vermont, in 1978.

questions.question: Which duo are the famous detective and his partner at 221B Baker Street?
questions.explanation: Sherlock Holmes and Dr. John Watson, created by Arthur Conan Doyle, are literature's most famous detective duo.

questions.question: The Everly Brothers were known for their close harmony singing. What were their first names?
questions.explanation: Phil and Don Everly had hits like 'Bye Bye Love' and 'All I Have to Do Is Dream' in the late 1950s and 1960s.

questions.question: Which dynamic duo founded Apple Computer in a garage in 1976?
questions.explanation: Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak founded Apple Computer in the Jobs family garage in Los Altos, California, in 1976.
